website_summaries.verdict: A long list of features and a comfortable fit make Fitbit’s new Flex the best fitness tracker you can buy.
pros: The Fitbit Flex is a simple way to track steps, sleep, and calories
The Flex's strap design makes it light and comfortable to wear
It also offers handy Bluetooth syncing, and Fitbit’s platform gives plenty ways to analyze your stats
cons: Clasping the Fitbit Flex’s strap shut is tricky
Direct syncing is only available with the iPhone, the Samsung GS3, and the Galaxy Note handsets

customer_reviews.title: Great product - short lifespan
customer_reviews.text: 1. I LOVE the fitbit. 2. I like the interface. 3. It's helped me lose weight and keeps me motivated. Why 3 stars? 4. I bought it in August of 2016 and now, less than a year later, it's stopped working. I take very good care of it. It's never gotten wet or dropped. I don't overcharge it. For $7.50 a month it's a good deal given I've easily underspent my normal food buying because I use the fitbit, BUT I would have expected it to last more than 10 months. Will I buy another? Yes because it helps me keep track of what I do each day. But I think they should last longer than 10 months.
customer_reviews.author: Cessa9870

customer_reviews.title: 6 Years and still working
customer_reviews.text: This fitbit flex is a tank. I've used it everyday for 6 years and it just keeps going. I have replaced bands (usually less than a dollar) several times and bought accessories. The core unit seems invincible though. Would not recommend purchasing in 2020, as it does not also tell time or have smart watch features, but for what it tries to do it does perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Motivater
customer_reviews.text: Loving it so far. My activity levels have increased, thanks to the motivation factor. I wear it on my ankle and have tested step count various times, and it seems highly accurate. When I cycle, it adds steps too, about a 1000 per 15 minutes of moderate cadence. You can order the x-large band (which fits better on the ankle) from the fitbit website for free.
customer_reviews.author: RegalStone

customer_reviews.title: 2nd time is the last time.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Fitbit to replace my first one that begin to fail and then finally died after little over a year of use. Guess what the same thing happened again. Seems like they die on purpose after a 12 - 14 months of use. No more wasting money on a product like this.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Mead

customer_reviews.title: RIP Fitbit. You will be missed.
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed my Fitbit while it lasted. It did everything it promised to do, although I don't believe it was worth the price. I especially liked that it tracked my movement during sleep and I can sync it with my Weight Watchers app. I only wish it was actually waterproof rather than "water resistant." Well, I got it wet during a 5k mud run. Yes, it was stupid of me to wear it during a mud run... I cleaned it off and followed manufacturer's instructions by leaving it in a bowl of dry rice for 24 hours. It still powers on but it won't hold a charge. RIP Fitbit. You will be missed.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: The band is JUNK- stay away unless you can find a way to secure it.
customer_reviews.text: The fitbit itself works fine. The band is GARBAGE. The clip is just a two pronged shallow attachment that you need to squeeze together. My fitbit popped off somewhere when I was berry picking or exercising. It was just...gone. It was immensely difficult to put on as well. Even a small strap to secure it would cost the company so little, but would have saved me the cash I spent on this. I am so sad I lost that much money. :(
customer_reviews.author: Young Shopper 123

customer_reviews.title: Great for tracking your step goals!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Fitbit Flex. It can popped into different colored bracelets or even stylish necklaces. It came with a dongle that connects to my computer so it updates my progress on the website for me to view anytime. I can also sync it with my phone so I can see how I'm doing. The little lights on the Fitbit indicate how you are progressing in your step goal without having to go to your phone or computer. It also lets you know how you slept the night before so you can see how many times you woke up or were restless.
customer_reviews.author: A Cox

customer_reviews.title: Batteries don't last
customer_reviews.text: The Fitbit Flex doesn't last. The first one I bought lasted about 18 months before it failed to hold a charge, even for 1 day. Cleaning the contacts didn't help. I bought another. It didn't last a year before it had the same problem. I tried to send them an email, but gave up after having to go through endless screens of questions and recommendations. I never got to the part where you could leave the email. I tried to call them. After about 15 minutes of getting them to recognize my account she started on the same questions/recommendations. This was just a phone version of the endless screens. I give up. I will find another activity tracker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super honest review.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: thin and light, easy to use (both the Fitbit itself and the app are super foolproof). I don't feel like the design interferes with my personal style or my daily functioning at all. Cons: if you're going to buy a Fitbit definitely get black bands. Within two weeks I went out and bought replacement bands in black due to the color bands showing wear and tear and dirt way too easily. They don't wash easily either. Also I developed a little rash from use when exercising due to the lack of breath ability of the band. I resolved this by wearing the band a bit looser.
customer_reviews.author: Reese

customer_reviews.title: refurbished but great
customer_reviews.text: I was very hesitant to order this charge 2 because it was refurbished. The company quit making them so it was either this or a newer model. Since I loved the one I had (dog got a hold of it!) I bought this one. I could not be happier. I waited a while to respond to make sure it would last. Still going strong and I would definitely recommend this company!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Susan H

customer_reviews.title: Slate Blue FitBit Flex
customer_reviews.text: Slate blue is a bluish grey. Looks exactly as pictured. Straightforward instructions and easy to assemble. Lightweight and doesn't feel like I have something heavy on my wrist. I am using the small band on the last notch. It is still a bit loose but doesn't twist around my arm. Easily charges on my PC and the display dots show the level the battery is charged to. I downloaded the app and it includes food caloric recordings, water intake level, sleep analysis and syncs with the Fitbit to record steps and calories burned. Overall I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: LegendofZelda

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY; DEVICE DEFECTIVE AND NO RETURNS
customer_reviews.text: I was excited about the color so that is the only thing good about it. It will not close!!! Falls off constantly. NOT WORTH IT. DO NOT BUY. DO NOT BUY. DO NOT BUY I paid too much not to have it even work once. I tried to send it back within a few days fearing it would not stay on my arm to no avail. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Imcega

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I am allergic to the band and closure clip. Want to return for credit. But states this product is not available for return. I can't use this product!! Very Upset that I have spent money on a product I can't use or return!!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Tomlin

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Bought as a replacement for the fitbit I had that accidentally got washed, so I already had different bands, and this new one is interchangeable. I can use it with all the accessories I bought for my original fitbit. Works great, love the program, very motivational!! And newest updates to provide community interaction and support makes the app that much greater. As for this product, it is a legitimate Fitbit band that works exactly as you would expect and the color of pink in the pic is the exact color you get with two different band sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Cici823

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed at the product...overpriced for what it is
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about a month now and it's already starting to have issues...randomly going into sleep mode without me tapping on it..battery life doesn't even last longer than 1 to 2 days with mine..extremely inaccurate as a pedometer... Most importantly, at random times..this device would "freeze" and I can't get out of the freeze mode(?). I don't even know how to explain it..it just stops working. Only way to fix this is to reset the fitbit using the charger..but I don't carry a charger with me all the time..
customer_reviews.author: Kalvin

customer_reviews.title: Fortunately I was able to find it on the living ...
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited when I received this item. Despite all the mixed reviews. I finally went ahead and bought it. However, it turned out I should've listened to the other reviewer's suggestion! The band fell off my wrist the first day that I wore it...not even one day, for only a few hours i lost it! I couldn't believe it.. 1st day.. Come on, really ?? Fortunately I was able to find it on the living room of my house. I am returning mine for sure. I just felt like for almost $90 I've spent, it should have a much secure design, I really really want to like it and use it, but the design is just horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Wish the app worked offline.
customer_reviews.text: I've had my Fit Bit since Christmas and it works fine. At first I had a lot of trouble getting it on. I almost had to use pliers to push the clasps through the holes. Since then the hole stretched and it's easier to get on. the only thing I don't like is that the app won't work if it's not on Wi Fi. Then I have to wait until later and I don't always remember everything I ate that day. One good thing about it is that it makes me more aware of how much I eat each day so it's easier to stick with the plan and loose weight.
customer_reviews.author: lorraine stewart

customer_reviews.title: I DON"T recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: This item is a piece of trash. It won't keep a charge longer than 18-20 hours, nor will it stay on the proper 24 hour calendar. I have written them and just get a run around. They tell me how to keep my battery charged, etc. I have had 3 of these before and have NEVER had a problem with them. No help for the problems I am having and no hope of a refund. I DON"T recommend this product. But at your own risk.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Battery wouldn’t hold a charge
customer_reviews.text: I purposefully ordered this product to have a new battery. Have a Fitbit Flex with a lot of colored bands. Can’t just buy a battery so I ordered the whole thing and this battery was worse than the one I have. Did everything I was instructed to do by Fitbit but still wouldn’t hold a charge. Returned it. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Christi W.

customer_reviews.title: Best investment for a healthy lifestyle!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I do not like about this is that the band gets easily dirty on the edges and I cannot seem to get it clean. That is my only complaint. Otherwise I absolutely love this thing!!! It has helped me to improve my diet and exercise plan so I can lead a healthier life. The challenges with my coworkers make me motivated to try harder so I can get first place. I am so obsessed with this and I will for sure be investing in the better ones at a later point in time. Especially one with a watch and heart rate monitor. I recommend this to anyone who wants to lead a healthier life!!
customer_reviews.author: Tasha

customer_reviews.title: Good for a first-time activity tracker
customer_reviews.text: I’m sure this has been covered in other reviews, but this generation of Fitbit is very basic (you might even do better with one of the knockoff activity trackers that infiltrate any search for Fitbits on Amazon). The good: Accurate (i think) step counting, functional alarm, good motivator to keep moving. It does what I need it to so I’ll stick with it until it dies. The meh: no pulse tracker, somewhat clunky/ugly, battery life definitely suffers over time
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: 2nd Flex purchase
customer_reviews.text: It's my second 'cause I lost the first one. Works great, tech online support was very helpful (synced to my phone and computer). I use it more for my 'sleep analysis' since I have arthritis and am NOT a big walker/runner. Yesterday, I was wearing it, fell asleep in my recliner and was surprised to find: Susan, looks like you took a 1 hr 51min nap. Hope you are well rested. I think that's cool........nice to know how long I was 'out' LOL .
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Have only used this product for 4 days- really like how it keep track of steps and sleep
customer_reviews.text: Have only used this product for 4 days- really like how it keep track of steps and sleep, a great motivator- however in 4 days I have lost it 3 times- the band is HORRIBLE! really difficult to put back on once you take it off- there is a really strange clasp that goes with it- I have no idea why they didn't use a buckle. Any movement involving your wrist- taking off a jacket for example, will make the band pop right off! So although the product is fun and a a good motivator- you will probably lose it within the first week! With that said, I did order a different band so I'm looking forward to that arriving.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Garrity

customer_reviews.title: I didn't care for this kind of band.
customer_reviews.text: I got one because my husband was getting one just not this one. I liked it at first although I don't think its really accurate especially on the sleeping. Alas I haven't worn a watch in years or bracelets because they are in my way when typing and didn't like wearing something while sleeping so I got over it and now just don't use it.
customer_reviews.author: Bette Genia

customer_reviews.title: Sadly it fell off and its lost
customer_reviews.text: i loved this product but the clasp came loose and i lost it at the renaissance faire, when i was enjoying my time and running around holding my skirts.. noticed it was gone and that was over. Don't think ill buy another, unless it has a more solid fastenable strap. I am sad to have lost it. i was having fun tracking my steps as i hike often.. and the app is nice to review my steps, track my weight, and water and calorie intake
customer_reviews.author: Liz E.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I used this for 2 months before upgrading to a better model, but it works great. The best part about fitbit is the software and web interface that you get when you buy it. Having the tracker on is a constant reminder of your goal, of course. But it all comes together nicely and allows you to get on a program and very easily follow it. Lack of organization is why I have always failed at weigh loss. As of today, I've lost 56 pounds in 4 months and I owe it all to the ability to organize and track my foods and exercise.
customer_reviews.author: V. Richie

customer_reviews.title: Lacks good customer support
customer_reviews.text: The device works as expected. The wrist bands don't last long and they refuse to accept the fact that many people are complaining. Great device, but very poor customer service. I eventually purchased some Chinese knock-off bands for a fraction of the price that are much more durable. Consider alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Kozlarek

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my defective product with no problem.
customer_reviews.text: Only 3 Stars for the product itself. Will repost when I get the replacement. My fitbit quit working correctly about 6 months after I purchased it. I attempted to go thru Amazon and Make Health First which Amazon was great however I was past the 90 days and Make Health First was pretty much useless. They wouldn't honor the product that they sold. I decided after much troubleshooting on line to contact fitbit themselves and boy am I glad I did. They actually, with no question (except date of purchase and order number) are sending me a replacement, free of charge!! I am totally impressed how they stood behind their product when no one else would.
customer_reviews.author: ds94ta

customer_reviews.title: Package & unit arrived damaged. Amazon won't exchange.
customer_reviews.text: Feel like I just got ripped-off by Amazon. Ordered this unit and it arrived with the plastic packaging partially melted (see image) and unit not functioning. After being stuck in the chat "help" for 20 minutes when trying to exchange, they informed me I was on my own and had to contact the manufacturer. I advise you to purchase elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price for just counting steps for 32 days
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Fitbit to help me track my progress in my effort to lose weight. It was great at counting my steps but not very helpful with the other areas I wanted it for. For example I would be at the gym for an hour and a half, working my heart out, lifting weights, doing cardio but all it would it would record was my steps. Then to add insult to injury, 32 days after I purchased it, it stopped working, no longer communicates with the app, nothing. Of course since it's been over the 30 days, I cannot return it, so I'm stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemarie Miller

customer_reviews.title: Battery won't stay charged on these Flex models -- too old!
customer_reviews.text: Apparently Fitbit Flex is no longer being produced, and so when we buy these from Amazon vendors they have been sitting on shelves for too long. I have purchased not one but THREE of these Flex models in the last two months, and all three are holding a battery charge for no more than two days. The advertised normal battery charge should last 5 days, and that was my experience with my prior Flex. Do not waste your money on the Flex as they likely have been sitting for 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: Lori D.

customer_reviews.title: Helpin my fiancee get a bit more fit
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my fiancee because she wanted one. She likes it a lot so far! She wears it pretty frequently, even if she's not going to the gym or anything. She's pretty active at work so it's cool to see how many steps she's taken during a shift. Also, the design is slim and not gross looking so a girl can wear it with any outfit and it'll go well, especially if it's black. Also, it's motivated her to get her steps in and even motivated her to go to the gym more often, so win win win for everywin! I mean, everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Yong L.

customer_reviews.title: It's simple to use and gives me enough information.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Fitbit Flex. It doesn't have all the bells and whistles of a lot of other Fitbits, but it gives me enough information, counts my steps and helps me get up and get moving because of the alarms I have set throughout the day. It's great.
customer_reviews.author: jojones

customer_reviews.title: Love my Fitbit Flex
customer_reviews.text: I love my Fitbit flex. The ability to track and monitor my results from my smart phone is very convenient. The fact that you can buy different colored bracelets to customize with my outfits is also a plus. I use the sleep monitor to see how I've been sleeping through the night and I love the silent alarm feature. The only negative I have and the reason for only 4 stars is that it also counts steps if you are moving your hand too much. I know you can expect that with wrist trackers, but I wish they could make it a little less sensitive.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Was great while it worked...
customer_reviews.text: This was a wonderful tool, it was very encouraging to have a way to track my distance and set goals, it really helped me to keep up with healthier habits. But unfortunately, they are not infallible. I have had my fitbit for over a year now, and it has started to glitch, it will turn itself off shortly after being taken out of the charger, sometimes a day later, sometimes almost as soon as it comes out. Tried rebooting it, tried updating, it works for a bit, then shuts off. I would buy another it they weren't so expensive.
customer_reviews.author: belizard88

customer_reviews.title: The Fitbit has a great battery life and has held up well
customer_reviews.text: This was bought for my 11 year old daughter. She absolutely loves it, wears it everyday. She was able to use the small wrist band that came with it. The Fitbit has a great battery life and has held up well, the band is easily wiped clean and is durable with daily wear and tear. The app is easy to access and use, the instructions explain the dots that are featured on the screen well. Color is true to picture may be a little more blue in it but still comparable. I would recommend this Fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: This is just OK. I had to return the first one I bought because it froze after a week. The return was easy but they made me wait for a new one until they received the old one. In most cases that is understandable, however, they determined that it was DOA remotely.I also wish the battery would last longer between charges. It also took awhile to sync the steps and distance, there was a great deal of trial end error. I used the formula they provided but it didn't work
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Fitbit Flex we have purchased. The first one the battery lasted about 9 months before it would not longer hold a charge. This one the battery didn't even last a month before it no longer holds a charge. We did all the tricks they tell you to try to make sure it charges correctly and those did not help. Couldn't send the first one back because we had it too long. This one is going back.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Not really on the Fitbit wagon, still good though.
customer_reviews.text: I like it and I don't. I should have purchased one where you could see the calories you have burned as I feel like that is a major down fall. I don't like that it doesn't register if I'm riding my bike. It doesn't fully capture my work out either. The app is okay and the tracking your sleep is awesome. It's kind of a glorified pedometer with a few extras. I think this is great for very inactive people or elderly people who want to get out and move. If you are serious about fitness I would opt for a different model or something completely different.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Buell

customer_reviews.title: I wasn't particularly impressed with the quality of the build or its appearance (not that I wasn't aware of what it looked like
customer_reviews.text: I wore my Flex for roughly two weeks before it broke; it simply stopped charging and restarted itself 14 times in a single day. Prior to that, I wasn't particularly impressed with the quality of the build or its appearance (not that I wasn't aware of what it looked like before I bought it). The frequent need for charging was off-putting and it ran out of battery in the middle of the day and without warning on multiple occasions. I returned it and got the Misfit Shine, which thus far has worked perfectly and looks more like a watch and less like equipment
customer_reviews.author: Sarah S

customer_reviews.title: Great solution if you keep your expectations in check....
customer_reviews.text: I think if you think of this as a disposable tool of sorts, things are great. The bands are definitely not designed to last long, esp. with true exercise (which is fine given the industry baseline and alternatives) and the charging mechanism is still quite unreliable - without the workarounds you'll find online to maintain proper contact between the pebble unit and the contacts. That said, I love the overall solution and tracking support and am on my third unit. In terms of accuracy, I find them conservative in terms of counting less steps vs. an iPhone and an Omron (proper pedometer) - which is fine in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: The vibrating feature when you reach your step goal is a nice touch. It's like a little "good job
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to spend the money, but the steps are WAY more accurate than my app on my phone and the battery lasts about 4 days. The vibrating feature when you reach your step goal is a nice touch. It's like a little "good job!" Updated 12/28/15: My flex stopped charging so I contacted Fitbit Customer Service through the app. They gave me suggestions to see if it would charge and when it didn't, they made getting a replacement painless! I had two positive customer service experiences in a row. I hardly knew what to do with myself!
customer_reviews.author: Deb Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I had issues updating the software at first but now everything is working great. There was a little issue with snapping onto my wrist but now its closing just fine. The plastic needs to stretch a bit before the clasp connects easily. I haven't had any issues with it being pulled open or snagging on anything like others have mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great economy activity tracker
customer_reviews.text: Great motivator and activity tracker without spending a lot. Can be addicting: "Gotta walk/run/calisthenics before I go to bed so I get my 10,000 steps in today". Doesn't feature readout of monitored activity, just a series of 5 indicator lights that progress in 20% increments until you reach the 10,000 step goal with all 5 lighted. But at less than half the price, I can use my computer or phone to see the actual numbers using the Bluetooth connection and free app. Good design, reasonable battery life (5-6 days).
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Faulty device...like for many others!
customer_reviews.text: It had been a wonderful little device for less than 2 months then it died on me...well I wished it had actually completely died instead of driving me nuts...Like for the others, it won't charge or even worse it will show me that it is charged with the 5 lights when it is actually completely dead. The charge won't even last 24 hours sometimes... I have heard that the customer service is actually quite good so I am waiting, but needless to say that they lost a future customer. Edit: Yes the Fidbit technical service is impeccable (hence the second star), but unfortunately it doesn't make the tracker better.
customer_reviews.author: ChristelleV

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in my Fitbit Flex. I was really enjoying it until it just stopped working less than two weeks after I bought it. My suspicion is that these devices are not as waterproof as they claim to be as it broke right after I washed my dog in the sink. $100 is a lot of money to put down on a faulty device. I'm just lucky that it happened before the Amazon return policy was up.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonianWoman

customer_reviews.title: Great supplement to monitoring exercise and sleep patterns
customer_reviews.text: Great supplement to monitoring exercise and sleep patterns. The downloadable software is very functional and easy to use. No supplied user manual but online instructions are fine. Would give it 5 stars but the clasp for the bracelet takes some getting used to (and practice!). If you are not careful it will not be secure (this is probably why some people say it falls off their wrist while running and they lose it). This could be easily solved if the manufacturer would include a band around the outside where the clasp is latched to give a "guide" to latching it.
customer_reviews.author: CST

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME! But treat with CARE!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these on Father's Day and we jumped right in to getting more fit. The charger for them is bit "big" so you need to make sure it's in there good. The wristbands are a bit on the fragile side so don't rip the tracker out of them caveman style. (Don't bend it!) Do it carefully. Clean your charger and tracker with alcohol wipes to keep them working properly. Mine completely stopped charging and I cleaned it with alcohol wipes and BOOM! Fixed. Take care of your stuff and you should have no problems. Had ours over a year already and they changed our lives.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Idea is great but quality not so much
customer_reviews.text: I received my Fitbit and the first few days were wonderful. I charged it once and never wore it in the shower but it started having trouble syncing to my phone and my computer. I followed instruction via the product website and reset it. It hasn't worked since. I was skeptical about spending over $80 because of the mixed reviews and I wish I would have listened to my gut. The idea is a great one but the quality of the product does not match the idea. I will try again but this time with a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit Program trouble
customer_reviews.text: My FitBit Flex worked great for about two weeks. Then I began having troublwe with the syncing. I kept getting an error: FitBit connect service has stopped. I uninstalled/reinstalled program 8 times. I called the 877-623-4997 help number and the person (outsourced of course) said he never heard of that and tried to get me to install on my cell phone. I had to angrily tell him NO after he insisted 3 times. He said he would have an supervisor in America call me back and they never did. (probably never even gave a message). The tech help was terrible and I would not recommend this product because of this problem. It started out really nicely. Sad about that.
customer_reviews.author: Rita

customer_reviews.title: Really Fitbit!!!
customer_reviews.text: -Bad wristband design. Bought two of these one was lost in the first 2 weeks. Wrist band comes loose. Need to buy after market bands to avoid this from happening. -The second stopped working 5 weeks after purchase. Just did not come up again. -When talking to CS rep. My packaging box clearly specifies flex is water resistant and you can shower with tracker. That's not correct, she indicated new packaging does not indicate this and they don't recommend this. -Granted they will send me a new one, pretty much will have to keep their CS number on speed dial product is sooooo bad!!!! Do yourself a favor look at Garmin or Jawbone or Apple watch or Microsoft band.
customer_reviews.author: AlpineFan

customer_reviews.title: Great gifts for the health-conscious! Monitors physical and rest activities alike! Set and achieve weight loss goals!
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair of these for my parents-in-law and they now wear it everyday to monitor their health more closely. These fitbits not only monitor the number of steps you walk, but also the quality of your sleep. You can even set up a workout target or a dietary goal to achieve per day! My in-laws seemed to really like them and find them useful. Might be a great idea to buy more color bands to match with different outfits. Not so sure about the 2-year warranties though; they didn't even bother to email them to me for weeks after the fitbits arrived, although they eventually did after I opened a case with customer service.
customer_reviews.author: jL

customer_reviews.title: It keeps track of everything pretty easily. The app is easy to use at ...
customer_reviews.text: The battery lasts from 4 days to a week usually. I keep my phone on continious updates so I think that drains the battery faster. It keeps track of everything pretty easily. The app is easy to use at some points and annoying at others. Overall the app is good though. I took off 1 star for the app being annoying when entering workouts, foods, etc. I took off another star because my band is breaking already. The back, where you put the sensor, has ripped on both sides. That said I still wear it every day and enjoy the "vibrate dance" the fitbit does when I hit 10k steps a day.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Coy

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: This device would not hold a charge of more than one day after wearing it for 3 days. Don't waste the money. Flex have not been produced in maybe 2-3 years and these models are sitting on the shelves as the batteries deteriorate.
customer_reviews.author: Lori D.

customer_reviews.title: Love it. My favorite part of this device is ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. My favorite part of this device is the dashboard that comes with it on my phone. I can see how many steps I take a day/converted into miles. The device emails you when you reach a total "marathon" distance (all miles combined). Another piece of the dashboard I like is the weight loss. You can set a goal weight you want to reach. As you lose weight and update it in on your dashboard, your AP tells you how many more pounds need you to lose to hit your goal. It's exciting to see it go down. Recommend this devise to all my friends who are interested in getting fit.
customer_reviews.author: luvnlife

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible product and FitBit knows it. Both of the items I received were defective. They would not charge properly. I went online for more information, and there are people everywhere having the same issue. Additionally, it does not function in an intuitive way. There is no button on the device for off and on, you are supposed to press on it in a certain place. Many times it does not respond. A light doesnt stay on to tell you it is on. It is just a big mystery.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Benner

customer_reviews.title: Brand new Fitbit flex and came with extra bands
customer_reviews.text: Love the great price and fast shipping. Brand new Fitbit flex and it came with extra bands. Yes I am wearing Apple Watch for texts/calls/heart rate and Fitbit for challenges, sleep, and more activities
customer_reviews.author: Amanda S

customer_reviews.title: Very unsatisfied
customer_reviews.text: My biggest complaint is that I CANNOT fasten the wrist band. I can't even get it to fasten when it is not on my wrist. I find it to be impossibly difficult. The software although easy to download and sync is not intuitive. I find tracking to be confusing....I have only managed to set the sleep tracker once out of 4 times correctly. I am planning to return this device. I am computer literate so it is not my lack of basic knowledge that is confounding me....
customer_reviews.author: Auntie Mame

customer_reviews.title: Popular...but it breaks all the time!
customer_reviews.text: Fitbits are popular, there's no doubt. However, they are inherently flawed. This is the third one we've owned...my second, and my wife has one. All of them have had to be sent back within six months because they stop working. Fitbit won't tell me if it's just the Flex or if it's the entire line. However, they ARE guaranteed for a year, but why spend the money if something is going to break down on you. I've talked to about 30 friends that have the Flex, and they ALL have had problems with it. Best to stay clear of this brand until the at least get the engineering figured out!
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Hoffer

customer_reviews.title: Not what I'd hoped for
customer_reviews.text: I'm really not sure how to rate this--it was purchased as a gift and the recipient seems to like it , but it doesn't do all the things I expected of it. I'm a bit disappointed, even though I'm not the one using it. It does, however operate as it says in the instructions and appears to perform it's limited functions satisfactorily. I'm sure I could have done more research and either purchased a different model or a different product, so some of the fault lies with me. Perhaps three stars is unfair, but I can't really say I like it or love it, so three stars it is.
customer_reviews.author: Ken M

customer_reviews.title: Going to look at other companies as totally disgusted and frustrated by this situation
customer_reviews.text: Fitbit has phased out this flex so they are not supporting tracker replacement. This unit has to be charged every night. Though I don't want to since I have invested in a lot of different bracelet tracker holders (won't be usable with the flex 2), I'll need another fitness tracker. Going to look at other companies as totally disgusted and frustrated by this situation. Not a friend of Fitbit any longer.
customer_reviews.author: Wahine

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE PRODUCTION CONTROL ON CHARGERS... 3 out of 3 chargers don't work...
customer_reviews.text: The device itself is worthy of a decent rating, however; I have had to return the initial one due to charging issues. Ends up it wasn't the device but the charger itself. Apparently this is a known issue. Received the replacement and guess what, charger doesn't work again... they sent a replacement for that one (charger only)... low and behold, doesn't work either... I finally just purchased a replacement charger from Amazon that was made by a 3rd party, this is the 1 out of 4 that has actually charged my device. This is pathetic manufacturing... Horrible quality control... and a joke... Please fit your production Fitbit otherwise you're gonna die off pretty soon...
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: I like the sleep tracking feature (which you do need the ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm only giving this four stars for one reason, the FitBit Flex with its wrist band seems to count extra steps. It seems a bit inaccurate and doesn't reflect my actual steps taking or walking. See my review on a FitBit Flex accessory for using this with your shoe. I like the sleep tracking feature (which you do need the wrist band for) and the phone app and tracking with FitBit online makes this a nice activity tracker. I think the battery needs a bit of work. I have to recharge this about every 4 days. If it would go for a week or 2 weeks at a time, would be much better.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Theodore Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fitness tracker from FitBit!
customer_reviews.text: These fitness trackers have worked great for myself and my wife. They have 2 bands that come in the package, a small and large. These are fine for most people's wrists but not my own. However, if you call/email Fitbit and tell them you need a XL band they will ship one for free (Takes a couple weeks also only comes in black/gray). They stay charged for around 5 days with my average use and syncing with the phone. No issues with the strap irritating my skin as I leave it on morning and night (the silent alarm is great). Hope this helps you with your purchase decision!
customer_reviews.author: TheWhitakerLife

customer_reviews.title: Love the Fitbit Flex
customer_reviews.text: Love the Fitbit Flex! The alarm on it is nice, much nicer to wake up to than a blaring alarm. Its easy to use and not too cumbersome to wear, some can be too chunky, but this one is a modest size. The two bands that come with it are helpful in figuring out which size is most comfortable and fitting. For charging, the Fitbit slips nicely out of the band and into its charging slot and back into the wristband. Set up is easy, especially as an experienced Fitbit user.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes it gets a little sweaty, but I'm noticing that less and less. There are prettier bands on the market, but be careful about sizing and performance. There is not interference with the name brand band, but the off brands aren't always allowing that little nugget to function inside. The only other drawback I saw was the tendency to need more charges than they said it would need, and losing that darn charger. The online materials are part of what makes this worth the purchase. I would recommend it as a good gym companion. Lots of positives, very light on the negative.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen R.

customer_reviews.title: I love my fitbit
customer_reviews.text: I love my fitbit! As a nurse who uses both arms a TON I did find that it overcounted for me even though placed on my non-dominant wrist. I countered that by changing the setting to 'dominant' while leaving on the non-dominant side. This seems to have worked well. I have counted steps to the tune of 5-600 and found it highly accurate most of the time. Yes, in that 600 count trek it missed a handful of steps, the lighter steps at the start/stop points but given that it picks up heavy arm movements I'm ok with that. Besides, those heavy arm movements are likely lifting a 100k patient so credit for that is legit!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: I loved it!
customer_reviews.text: I am saddened to write this review. I have had the Fitbit for 2 years. I loved it!! When it worked. But for about 1.5 years of the time that I have had it, it didn't. The first time it broke, I wrote into the manufacture who sent me a new one right away. Then, about 6 months later, it stopped working all together. The saddest part is, I bought three all together. None of the three work anymore. $300 down the drain. I should have listened to the reviews I read about it's quality. Overall, it is great if it decides to work, but most likely it won't last you long.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Weeks

customer_reviews.title: Really like it!
customer_reviews.text: I've really enjoyed this. I wish it had a watch with it, but that's coming out next year so I may upgrade. But the step counter is accurate and I really like the alarm function. I can be rushing around and lose track of time but then the alarm goes off and I know exactly what time it is and I get back on track. Lots of options to go along with the free app. The most helpful is the water tracker. You record it and it keeps track for you. A good reminder to make sure you're getting enough water. Very pleased and wear it daily. Battery is pretty decent too.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Fish

customer_reviews.title: Change your life one step at a time.
customer_reviews.text: My daughters gave me my flex for Father's Day 2014, and I would be lost without it- Logging my sleep is the first thing I do in the morning, and checking my steps for the day is the last evolution at night. I appreciate the weekly summaries and the periodic awards- My last was the Great Barrier Reef award for 1600 cumulative miles. It's a great silent motivator to keep moving. I walk the dog enthusiastically now. Most days. A very nice feature for me is the way my Fitbit lets me know how the everyday evolutions of life add up to a lot of steps. After all, isn't that what life is all about?
customer_reviews.author: Husky Bobalina

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service is BAD!
customer_reviews.text: The product was a pain to charge once a week and you have to remember to put it into sleep mode when you go to sleep or it does not record it. It should do this automatically. But my biggest complaint is that it quit working after 1 year and 1 week (ya, one week out of warranty) and their customer service was absolutely horrible. You would think that they would stand by their product but they did not. I received it for my birthday from my two little girls and a few days after my next birthday it stopped working. I will NEVER buy a Fitbit product after dealing with the customer service person that I dealt with!!!!
customer_reviews.author: coach66

customer_reviews.title: I like the Fitbit in general
customer_reviews.text: I like the Fitbit in general. It's easy to use. But it definitely doesn't have anywhere near 5 days of battery life. More like 24-36 from a full charge. That can be frustrating if I want to use it to track sleep as well as activity. UPDATE: I turned off the setting for All-Day Synch, and that made a world of difference. Now the charge lasts the advertised time.
customer_reviews.author: SD

customer_reviews.title: Not for small wrists.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't have some of the advertised features on the website, directions on the website are unclear. This is not a good product for people with very narrow wrists, the stiff part is the full width of my wrist so even the small band doesn't help, making it very uncomfortable to wear. Hopefully they'll make a women's/kid's version soon (not in pink please!). That said, it's the best choice in the product line & in comparable products for people with small wrists. Initial setup was fairly easy.
customer_reviews.author: Bethann

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit has a great APP for tracking food as well for weight loss ...
customer_reviews.text: I love/like this little contraption. I just wish that it was a buckle clasp, it's fallen off at least 10 times and I lost it once at a concert. Luckly it was turned in! I also wish it was waterproof....otherwise, it tracks my activity & sleep. Fitbit has a great APP for tracking food as well for weight loss goals. I purchased the Fitbit scale which is synced to my Fitbit Flex. Yesterday I decided to up my "game" and purchased the Fitbit Surge, it's waterproof and won't fall off my wrist...among other great features.
customer_reviews.author: mudprof

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit Problems
customer_reviews.text: I have a Fitbit flex that was given to me as a gift. There are three problems I have with it that would prohibit me from recommending this to anyone to purchase. First it is almost impossible to recharge. I followed Fitbit's recommendation To clean the contacts and I still need to spend ten or so minutes for the blinking bar to remain on. Second, it does not register steps while used on a treadmill. For example, today I walked three miles on my Nordic Track and only had 1400 steps. Third, the site is difficult to access and navigate through. I have a new computer, and have no problems with Internet, since I can easily access other sites.
customer_reviews.author: Richard McGuire

customer_reviews.title: and love it. Never knew how much I (didn't) walk ...
customer_reviews.text: Wear it all day, and love it. Never knew how much I (didn't) walk until I started monitoring. Challenge with friend keeps me at my goal of 10,000 steps a day - sometimes a bit more. I don't wear it at night, since sometimes my arm is itchy from all the sweating I do during the day and think it is better to take it off at night. Hate to have it off when I walk! Wish I could track swimming and other things but this is great - and maybe - if I keep it up, I will even upgrade to one with a heart monitor. It really keeps you going!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: I really like the Flex
customer_reviews.text: I really like the Flex, but I wanted to give other customers an FYI. I ordered one for my daughter as a gift, and the photo shows how it came to me from Amazon--- in a little plastic bag, no label or instructions on it. My Flex, also from Amazon, came to me in a nice box--with instructions--just as you see in the store. If I had sent this directly to my daughter, she would not have even known what it was!
customer_reviews.author: B. Lee

customer_reviews.title: My first Fitbit Flex lasted about one year and one ...
customer_reviews.text: My first Fitbit Flex lasted about one year and one month. In that time, I needed to replace the bracelet twice and the charger once (through Fitbit Support). Then it died. (Regular usage, nothing extreme.) Fitbit Support sent me a replacement, which lasted about three months, then that one died. The next one lasted two months, then Fitbit Support wouldn't send me another one, but offered me 25% off if I buy it at Fitbit.com. I'm giving it one more shot. If this next one doesn't last more than a year, I'm giving up on the Fitbit brand.
customer_reviews.author: TSMC

customer_reviews.title: I love this pink fitbit so much
customer_reviews.text: I love this pink fitbit so much. This is my first fitbit. I can't believe it. Now I can use it to track my steps, heart rate, sleep, and even my exercise routines. Every time I play the Wii for workouts and go to college to walk from class to class, I always had my fitbit by my side, and it lets me know for how many steps I took. Amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Kriwer

customer_reviews.title: Great Motivator!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband after I got one for Christmas (of course I gave him my black bands and I use the pink ones). We enjoy these very much! I definitely would like to upgrade to one that displays the time because I often find myself looking at it like it is a watch and I also would like to get one that tracks your heart rate and floor counts! My husband and I love the challenges. This has helped us become more aware of our activity levels so we can get ourselves back to a healthy weight post children.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany B.

customer_reviews.title: This will improve your health
customer_reviews.text: Wearing the Fitbit really motivates you to do more. Being able to see your steps in real time, and also participating in challenges with your other friends who have fitbits makes being more active fun and stimulates a little friendly competition. I also love that it tracks my sleep and how often I wake up during the night. I feel as though my overall health has improved since I bought this around the beginning of the year.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Smith

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: It worked well and I really liked it......too bad it quit working 65 days later for no reason. It would not charge. Returns are accepted by Fit Bit up to 45 days. Amazon's return period was exceeded so I will see if the credit card will provide some reimbursement. If I am successful I will update this review. With that said it is still doesn't work and I'm out the purchase price. Also don't forget that some people get a rash if it is worn too long - check the web site. I suggest you consider another product.
customer_reviews.author: smgu3

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product and application! Keeps track of my steps and logs my sleep. The band itself can get a little dirty, so I suggest cleaning it or getting a different color like grey or black. The lighter color bands tend to stain or turn darker around the edges with heavy use. Overall, I'm very satisfied with my product! Just be sure to buy the silicone fasteners; the metal fastener tends to become loose over time. My mother lost hers twice already, but I got her the silicone fasteners and we've not had an incident yet!
customer_reviews.author: Keiko G.

customer_reviews.title: Lousy product; Lousy support
customer_reviews.text: Gave up on making this work. Stopped working after a month. Tried to contact customer support - never got a response from FitBit. Helped by other users to re-set and continued to struggle over the months to use it. IT would work for awhile, then stop. Finally gave up the ghost after Christmas. To have a device that worked intermittently from the beginning and then stopped completely in less than 8 months means it is a really inadequate device. This was only compounded by Fitbit's complete lack of response. Giving up on Fitbit. As I love the tracking information, am going to try the new Jawbone - based on reviews in Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Rani

customer_reviews.title: hmmm
customer_reviews.text: Bought it as a gift. Recipient loves it. Seems a little simplistic in what it does though the sleep tracking function is cool. Very poor instructions and initial setup of application is very poorly designed, needlessly complicated and poorly documented. Very cluttered website with poorly laid out links. After you get past initial setup things get easier. Maybe the Fitbit people need to test their web/app design on the general public, not just web design specialist/enthusiast, and reconsider some things.
customer_reviews.author: T Tass

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I love this! It works great! It works best when used in conjunction with the FitBit app, so that you can keep track of your steps in real time. I also use it in conjunction with the My Fitness Pal app, as they work together, so that when you get more steps in, my fitness pal will adjust your calorie limits for the day. Several on my friends also have fitbits, and we "compete" with each other for most steps in a day, week, etc. They all love it. I also really like tracking my sleep. Can't say enough good things about this, I recommend it to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Di

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Great battery life, no problems with clap
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace the Charge HR I got for christmas which didn't hold a charge for more than 2 days with the HR function disabled. Haven't had any issues with the Flex. It stays on no problem, fits well, and the battery lasts a week. The small band fits great on my wrist and the large fits my ankle, for those times when I am moving things around or walking the dog and hence my arm is not moving while walking- meaning I would lose all those steps. I had bought some of the silicone bands to help keep the flex clasped- but haven't noticed that they are needed.
customer_reviews.author: Kasnia

customer_reviews.title: Loved it..now hate it
customer_reviews.text: I definitely don't recommend this product and I don't recommend FitBit. The Flex stopped tracking active minutes, and I was told that if I'm doing an activity too often then the tracker identifies it as "regular" activity and I would need to intensify the activity. So that would mean that if I were to jog 5 miles every day, the tracker would assume that's "regular" activity, and I'd need to increase to 7 1/2 miles. This is a piece of junk, and I hate it.
customer_reviews.author: MFCooke

customer_reviews.title: Major charging issues with Flex
customer_reviews.text: After 3 months the charging started to fail. You had to hold the unit in the charger or tape it in to get it to charge. If you follow the detailed instructions on their website on how to clean the unit you can get it working again temporarily. It then started to fail after fully charging requiring several resets. I think the charging cable is designed poorly, there are hundreds of charging complaints on their website and Customer Service is now assisting me but I think they are overwhelmed. I will update based on their response, going on 3 days with no tracking. FitBit responded and are sending a new FitBit!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but more limited than I expected
customer_reviews.text: On the plus side, I found the Flex to be comfortable, easy to put on and take off (after some practice), and seemingly accurate in regards to the number of steps taken. However, having had the Fitbit One in the past, I was disappointed by the limited display; five LEDs don't give you much information about your daily progress. The inability to track vertical steps was also a surprise, and like some other reviewers, I found that bumpy bus or bike rides would cause the Flex to switch between modes. I'm hoping that the upcoming Fitbit Force will address these problems, but for now, I've stopped wearing the Flex.
customer_reviews.author: Cyrus & Kelly M

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time, unless you want to be fustrated
customer_reviews.text: The concept behind this is great, but I have had my flex for a few months now so I can give it a fair review. I have had a range of issues stemming from syncing issues, to every time I travel it doesn't work, the app on my phone can't find the flex even if its right next to the phone with the bluetooth on. The flex freezes and it doesn't charge properly. I am actually to the point of not using it any more and looking for something better. I can honestly say its not worth the money or the trouble. Also my bf has the one and he has issues with it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Missy L

customer_reviews.title: Your first and basic fitbit but certainly does the job ...
customer_reviews.text: Your first and basic fitbit but certainly does the job. This was a replacement to the first one that I had for over 2 yrs. Already had different bands for it so decided to continue with this particular model. If you don't need/want all the bells and whistles, this fitbit is the way to go at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Cathleen S

customer_reviews.title: I wear the Flex all of the time, including the times when I take a shower and when I sleep.
customer_reviews.text: I log my data on my laptop every other day. I charge the device once a week. It has worked perfectly since it arrived. I have lost 55 pounds by using the Flex to log my activity. I check my progress at about 7 PM each night to see how much more I need to walk to reach my daily goal of 10,000 steps and 10 flights of stairs. I excise more until I reach my daily goals. The Flex lights up and vibrates when I hit my goals. The dashboard on the web page for Fitbit takes my data and draws graphs which help me understand my daily workout. I recommended the Flex.
customer_reviews.author: E. D. Hance

customer_reviews.title: I would Buy it again
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Fitbit Flex mainly for tracking my sleep. I have a lot of pain issues and wanted to have something to be able to show my doct or on how i thought my pain was affecting my sleep. This is exactly what my Fitbit has let me do. It is also something I can use to keep me on track with eating healthy. My own complaint is not being able to wear in the pool to track my exercise there. This is the only type of exercise I am allowed to do and it would be nice to have an accurate report on what I am doing. Overall I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Huggins

customer_reviews.title: Won't hold charge.Waste of time and effort.
customer_reviews.text: My Flex will not stay charged.I've had it for less than a week.I charged it fully when it arrived,synced it to my phone and was ready to go.It is supposed to keep a charge for about five days.By noon of day 2 it wouldn't sync or record steps.It said battery was fully charged,but when I finally gave up and popped it in the charger it showed zip.I'm returning it.And probably won't bother with another tracker like this again.Too much work.I'm going back to my low tech step counting pedometer.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene Smith

customer_reviews.title: Worst ever set up-frustrating
customer_reviews.text: Setting up the FitBit was the worse ever and I am very comfortable with setups normally. Instructions were very vague and unnecessarily complicated. The install wasn't too bad but left much to the imagination. However, I had to find message boards, help sites and YouTube to get the synching and linking to work. The main confusion surrounded the 'dongle' and when and how to get the FitBit charged and the order in which to plug everything in. I am sure this will be a wonderful product, but I think it was unnecessarily confusing to set up and has left a bad impression
customer_reviews.author: J. T. Perry

customer_reviews.title: I like the fit and feel of the fitbit on my ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the fit and feel of the fitbit on my wrist. The program is nice and it is a motivating tool. The downsides of this product, as compared to the body media fit are: having to put fitbit in sleep mode, and details about calorie burn. The body media fit automatically reads when you are sleeping, so no need to fuss with taps to engage or disengage mode. Also, bumpy rides or burping a baby (haha) confused my fitbit several times. I found myself in "sleep mode" when I was doing these activities.
customer_reviews.author: Tami Bassett

customer_reviews.title: Works about a year
customer_reviews.text: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!! I started having problems with it charging at 6 months. Now it won't charge at all. Contacted FitBit and they got me to try a few other things. I ended up buying a fitness tracker from another maker which charges just fine. I've tried cleaning contacts, but it totally quit charging about a month ago. It was cool while it worked, but I wouldn't recommend my worst enemy spend money to get it! Spending this money for about 9-10 months use, and having to fight the charger constantly is a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: DanT

customer_reviews.title: Worst company ever.... go with Garmin or Apple... anything would be better
customer_reviews.text: Worst company ever! Watches stop working, won’t even charge... after many calls to the company, they replaced it and the “new” one and IT also stopped working after 2 months... called Fitbit and there is “nothing they can do, but we are feel to purchase a new watch” Really!?!? The same thing happened with my daughter’s Ionic AND my son’s Ace..... Fitbit has lost our family as customers and it is really sad because I was a very loyal fan for 10 years
customer_reviews.author: Tara McCullough

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: It's basically an expensive alarm clock for me, but it's neat to see how much i walk in a day. My job is basically 5 jobs, shipping/receiving, warehouse/surplus inventory, PC deployment, picking up old equipment, and hardware repairs. I go between buildings and walk a over 5 miles a day on average. the tracker is independent from the phone once alarms and other settings are synced, so even if you party hard and your phone dies, your fitbit is still an alarm cause the battery lasts like 3 days. not bad, but not quite $100 worthy. Comes with a large and small wristband, but only one piece to clip it together. Charger is kinda goofy but charges it quick.
customer_reviews.author: herpderp

product_meta.title: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black, Small/Large
product_meta.description:
Color:Black| Size:Small/LargeNever stop moving with Fitbit Flex. Wear this slim, stylish device all the time and get the motivation you need to get out and be more active. It tracks steps, distance, and calories burned and shows you how you’re stacking up against your daily goals. At night, it tracks your sleep cycle, helps you learn how to sleep better, and wakes you silently in the morning. Access your stats anytime on your computer, tablet or from leading smartphones – both iPhone and Android. Flex is your perfect companion, it’s with you everywhere even in the shower. Plus, it looks good no matter what you’re wearing.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
• Certain features like Auto Sleep Tracking and SmartTrack may be disabled when using this accessory. Classic accessory bands are the recommended accessory for high intensity workouts and sleep tracking. • Do not wear the Flex 2 Pendant accessory while sleeping or during high intensity activity, as doing so could create a choking hazard. • Flex 2 Pendant accessories contain magnets. Magnets may interfere with pacemakers, defibrillators, or other medical devices. Consult your physician and the manufacturer of your medical device before using to determine if these accessories are safe for you. If the accessories may be interfering with your pacemaker, defibrillator, or other medical device, do not wear the accessories.

BUYING GUIDE
Move it up: Since blood increases further up your arm, wear your tracker higher on your wrist to improve the heart rate signal during workouts. Start by moving the device up to three finger widths above your wrist bone, then experiment with slightly lower placement. Keep it secure: The less your tracker moves during exercise, the more chance you have of maintaining a heart rate signal throughout the activity. Do not wear the band too tightly, as this can restrict blood flow and goes against our wear and care guidelines. Hold steady for ten seconds: High intensity exercises or activities that cause you to keep your wrist bent (like push-ups) or move your arms vigorously (like dance) may interfere with heart rate signals. If you stop seeing a signal during these types of activities, hold your wrist steady for ten seconds during breaks to get your reading.

feature_bullets: One syncs automatically and wireless to tablets, computers and 150+ leading iOS, Android and Windows smartphones using Bluetooth 4.0 wireless technology. Syncing two computers requires Internet connection and USB port. Syncing to mobile devices requires Bluetooth and Internet connection. Syncing range: 20 feet. Call notifications via Bluetooth 4.0

Water Resistance: Charge has been tested up to 1 ATM meaning it is sweat, rain and splash proof. However, the device is not swim proof. We also recommend taking charge off before showering because, as with any wearable device, it’s best for your skin if the band stays dry and clean
Warning: Do not use if you have a pacemaker or other internal, or implanted medical device. Not intended for use by children under 13. Always consult your physician. Slippery when wet
We recommend charging your device every few days to ensure you are always tracking. Charge time: One to two hours. Battery life: up to 7 - 10 days. Battery type: Lithium-polymer
